entries.date_ce: late 18th century (c. 1787 terminus ante quem, Fethizâde vakf seal)
key_features: TRIPLE-TECHNIQUE album: tughra + zerefşân + halkâr — all confirmed at IIIF resolution
Tughra calligraphy on gold zerefşân ground with polychrome halkar margins
Three calligraphers identified by ketebe: İsmâʿîl Zühdî, Mahmûd Tophanevî, Hâfız Yûsuf
Fethizâde Mustafa Efendi vakf seal dated AH 1202/1787-88 (terminus ante quem); YEK ID 325921; 20 pages

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: MATCHED HATIP EBRU COVER PAIR — identical silhouette marbled paper on front and rear covers; unique in corpus
Battal ebru + pink mulevven + grey mulevven interior margins; deliberate chromatic variety per opening
Derviş Ömer el-Cüdî meşk kaydı; sülüs-nesih Qaṣīdat al-Muḍariyya; YEK ID 705423; 5 folios

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: SILHOUETTED/STENCILED DECORATED PAPER (çiçekli kâğıt, probable 0.60) — dense gold floral margins on ALL calligraphy pages; halkar not excluded
Two full-page gold garden compositions with cypress trees (pp. 003r, 014l)
Zerkârî calligraphy substrate throughout; sülüs-nesih meşk format; YEK ID 705380; 13 folios / 16 pages

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: ŞEYH HAMDULLAH AH 901 — earliest securely dated muraqqaʿ in corpus; 4 ketebe records with variant name forms
Compound candy-stripe cedvel framing (5–7 bands: green, gold, salmon, cream diagonal stripes) on ALL pages
Bāyezīd II-era lacquer binding; blue-gold serlevha; sülüs-nesih-icāze; YEK ID 705373; 4 folios

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: FIVE-TECHNIQUE multi-calligrapher album: battal ebru + zerefşân + mulevven + hatip ebru cover + cetvelli
Karahisârî (960/1553) + Hâfız Osmân (1085/1675) — two of the 'three pillars' of Ottoman calligraphy in one album
8 named calligraphers across 170 years; 10 yaprak / 10 IIIF pages; YEK ID 705432

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: COMPREHENSIVE BATTAL EBRU — stone marbling on ALL surfaces: both covers AND all 5 interior openings
3–4 distinct battal ebru color palettes across openings (pink/rose → grey-blue/teal → lavender → cream/yellow-green)
Hüseyin Haffâfzâde ketebe on all 10 pieces; AH 1149 on pieces 3–4; YEK ID 705426; 10 yaprak

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: SYSTEMATIC WARM/COOL TWO-SCHEME MARBLING: pink/rose battal left margins, blue-grey battal right margins across all 5 openings
GEL-GIT ebru on p006 left -- sole non-battal variant in interior; rare accent in TIEM murakka corpus
Probable HALKAR-ON-EBRU floral overlay (green sprigs + red dots) on pink battal margins pp004/005/007 left (0.75)
Complete AKLAM-I SITTE (six-script) exhibition album: sulus, nesih, muhakkak, reyhani, tevki, icaze. No calligrapher/date. 10 kitaa. YEK ID 705417.

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
key_features: RARE RED/PINK serpme — only 2nd non-gold serpme in corpus; physical exam urgently needed to identify the sprinkled substance
Red/pink serpme in dual structural role: full-ground endpapers (pp001+008) AND inner border band of compound cedvel on all 6 calligraphy spreads
Yesârî Mehmed Es'ad ketebe confirmed on p007 (d. 1213/1798) — foremost Ottoman taʿlîk calligrapher; hurûfât pedagogical mesk album
European floral fabric/printed-paper doublures (p009) — late 18th-century Ottoman-European binding hybrid; unique in corpus

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
entries.date_ce: late 15th–early 16th century (c. 1485–1525, attributed to Şeyh Hamdullah circle)
key_features: RICHEST POLYCHROME MÜLEVVEN in corpus: 5 distinct colors (yellow, sage-green, pink, blue-grey, lacivert) across alternating openings in palindromic sequence
BATTAL EBRU as final calligraphy opening margins (p007, vivid red-blue-cream) — potentially earliest Ottoman battal ebru if Şeyh Hamdullah circle attribution accepted
MATCHED HATIP EBRU DOUBLURE PAIR (pp. 001, 009) — pinkish-red curvilinear marks + scattered blue-green bird motifs on cream; symmetrical bilateral frame
Attribution: el-fakir İbnü'ş-Şeyh ketebe (Son of the Shaykh — indirect Şeyh Hamdullah attribution); 10 kıtʿa sülüs-nesih hadith; Ayasofya 4883 provenance stamp on p002
YEK ID 705422; IIIF ID 0000000662635; 10 yaprak / 9 IIIF pages; 245×152 mm

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع (meşk muraqqaʿı)
key_features: 4th confirmed hatip ebru in corpus; spectacular pink+orange flowers on grey-green battal ground (front cover p001)
MISMATCHED COVER PAIR: hatip ebru front vs. abstract leaf/petal ebru back (p015) — unique in corpus; possible repair/replacement
Meşk muraqqaʿı (practice album): 21 harf meşki in sülüs-nesih, no ketebe or date
Interior margins plain cream/nohudi throughout; triage-claimed mülevven NOT confirmed at IIIF native resolution; YEK ID corrected 705363→705372

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: MATCHED HATIP EBRU COVER PAIR — 3rd confirmed hatip ebru in corpus
Polychrome pink-pigment floral margin decoration (unique non-gold margin pigment)
6-script aklâm-ı sitte program (muhakkak, reyhânî, sülüs, nesih, nestaʿlîk, tevkîʿ)

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع (Murakkaʿât / 11 Kıtʿa)
key_features: 5th confirmed hatip ebru in corpus — UNIQUE heart-shaped golden motifs (vs. rosette/flower type in all other corpus specimens)
Battal ebru on ALL 9 calligraphy pages, each a distinct sheet with its own palette — one of the most systematic battal ebru margin programs in corpus
Dual ebru subtype combination (hatip cover + battal margins) — paralleled only by tiem_02489 in corpus
Pink/rose mülevven strips as writing surface for selected sülüs lines (pp009 bottom, p011 top); Hamidiye waqf provenance; YEK ID 265201

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Pertevniyal Koleksiyonu
entries.title: Qaṣīdat al-Burda / قصيدة البردة
entries.author: Muḥammad ibn Saʿid al-Būṣīrī
key_features: MOST SYSTEMATIC coordinated cetvel-mülevven program in corpus — cetvel color changes every opening to complement margin paper color across 8 documented pairings
UNIQUE zerefşân-on-lacivert mülevven (pp018-019) — only murakkaʿ in corpus combining colored paper and zerefşân in this combination
Probable Seyyid Abdullah el-Yedikuli attribution (d. 1144/1731) — ketebe p035 reads al-Sayyid ʿAbdullāh; Burda Qaṣīda complete in 34 sülüs-nesih leaves
Polychrome mülevven in 7+ confirmed hues: olive-green, yellow, sage-green, lacivert, orange, pink/mauve, rose pink; 19 of 36 pages unexamined

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
paper_categories: mülevven kâğıt (5 renk + pembe kapak içliği)
zerefşân (kırmızı, yeşil, sarı marginda teyit edildi)
key_features: FIVE-TECHNIQUE album: hatip ebru cover + five-color mulevven margin sequence + zerefşân + tezhipli köşe parçaları + compound cetvelli vassale system
RARE LAVENDER/MAUVE-PURPLE mulevven (pp007–008) — first confirmed lavender mulevven in Hamidiye corpus; significant addition to project color inventory
2-LAYER MULEVVEN SYSTEM: each of 5 openings uses both a distinct outer margin color AND a contrasting inner border band color (iç pervaz) — 10 distinct mulevven applications total
TWO calligraphers identified by ketebe: Beşikerzâde (pp003–008, sülüs-nesih hadith) and Muhammed Râsim (pp009–010); hurufat mesk on pp011–012

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Pertevniyal Koleksiyonu
entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
key_features: ONLY album in corpus combining mülevven AND battal ebru: 2 mülevven pages (P1 orange, P4 yellow) + 4 battal ebru pages (P6 teal, P8 mixed, P9-P10 polychrome)
PP9-10 polychrome battal ebru (5+ colors: red, green, grey-blue, yellow, cream) — among the finest in the corpus
P7 probable boya efşân (0.70): pink/rose pigment-sprinkled paper; 2nd non-gold serpme candidate in corpus (after vahid_pasa_01220)
Ismaʿil al-Zuhdī (d. 1221/1806), student of Mustafa Râkım; ketebe on P10; Pertevniyal Valide Sultan imperial waqf; YEK ID 320125; IIIF ID 0000000361865; 10 yaprak

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
paper_categories: bileşik cedvel (altın + çam yeşili + altın + koyu kahve)
key_features: POLYCHROME BATTAL EBRU with 3–4 distinct palette variants across 5 decorated surfaces (cover + 4 calligraphy-page margins)
Two-zone marbling effect: lighter inner battal ebru border strips + vivid outer margin fields on all calligraphy pages
4-band compound cedvel (gold / sage-green / gold / dark brown-black) paralleling hamidiye_00010 and tiem_02471
Partially legible ketebe on p006 ('kataba-hu al-faqīr...'); Hamidiye vakf; YEK ID 265194; IIIF ID 0000000289495; 6 pages

entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقع
paper_categories: mülevven kâğıt (4 renk: sarı, yeşil, pembe, turuncu)
key_features: FIVE-CATEGORY decoration program: matched hatip ebru covers + 4-color mulevven sequence + polychrome halkar borders + illuminated/zerkari grounds + compound cedvel with ebru inner borders
ORANGE MULEVVEN (pp009–010) unique in project corpus; 4-color mulevven progression: yellow → olive-green → pink/salmon → orange
Dated AH 947/1540-41 — one of the earliest dated specimens in corpus; Shah Muhammad ketebe (probable Safavid-trained nastaʿlīq master)
Matched hatip ebru cover pair with large naturalistic composite rosettes; halkar-on-mulevven on pp007–011; YEK ID 265209; 13 pages

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Nuri Arlasez Koleksiyonu
entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
key_features: Two-zone decoration: vivid polychrome battal ebru covers (red/navy/cream, p001) + uniform saffron-yellow mülevven on ALL interior calligraphy pages (pp003-013)
TRIAGE CORRECTION: triage claimed battal ebru throughout + blue mülevven — corrected to ebru on covers only; interior is yellow mülevven (not blue)
Battal ebru two-palette contrast: vivid exterior (red/navy/cream) vs. subdued doublure (brown/grey-blue + scattered blue speckles)
First yellow-mülevven-only muraqqaʿ documented in corpus; Nuri Arlasez donation in memory of Raif Yelkenci; YEK ID 406102

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
paper_categories: mülevven kâğıt (5 renk: pembe, yeşil, sarı, turuncu/toprak rengi, krem/nohudi)
polychrome block border / çok renkli blok bordür (pp014–016 — UNIQUE in corpus)
key_features: UNIQUE POLYCHROME BLOCK BORDER (pp014–016) — only rectangular block-border framing in 73-record corpus at time of cataloguing: two palette variants A (pink+yellow+terracotta+olive+cream) on pp014–015 and B (yellow+olive+cream) on p016; triage term 'zencirek' RECLASSIFIED — blocks are rectangular cartouches, not chain rings
FIVE-COLOR MULEVVEN sequence: pink (p006R), green (p008R), yellow (p013), orange/terracotta (p016 outer margin), cream/nohudi (baseline) — with zerefşân visible on pink and green margins
FOUR calligraphers by ketebe: Yûsuf (student of Hâfız Osmân, d. 1698); Ramazân; Hamdullah ibni'ş-Şeyh; Muhammed Arabzâde — linking Şeyh Hamdullah and Hâfız Osmân lineages in a single album
Fethizâde Mustafa Efendi vakf seal AH 1202/1787–88 (shared with SM 00003 and SM 00009); YEK ID 325914; IIIF ID 0000000356074; 22 yaprak; 8 of 20 pages examined

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Nuri Arlasez Koleksiyonu
entries.title: Muraqqaʿ / مرقعات
paper_categories: battal ebru (5 palet varyantı — en çeşitli Nuri Arlasez albümü)
gel-git ebru (p003 — IIIF çözünürlüğünde teyit edildi)
kırmızı lak cilt (rumi arabeskli şemse + salbek)
key_features: MOST PALETTE-DIVERSE Nuri Arlasez album: 5 distinct battal ebru palette variants + 1 gel-git ebru (p003, 5-color, confirmed at IIIF resolution) across 12 pages — gel-git confirmed by sinuous feather/flame shapes from single-stylus movement, distinct from taraklı parallel striations

TRIAGE CORRECTION: triage claimed blue mülevven throughout entire album — corrected by IIIF exam to polychrome battal/gel-git ebru as outer margin grounds; mülevven appears only as narrow teal/pink alternating inner strips between ebru and gold cedvel
THREE-LAYER compound framing system on every spread: (1) battal/gel-git ebru full outer margin, (2) narrow mülevven inner strip (teal or pink, alternating), (3) compound multi-band gold cedvel

Red lacquer rumi-arabesque şemse+salbek binding (p001); dated AH 1195/1781 CE by ketebe p012; calligrapher Muhammed el-Vasfî; meşk abjad sülüs album; YEK ID 406230; IIIF ID 0000000398191; 10 yaprak; 8/12 pages examined

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
entries.date_ah: before 1202 AH (terminus ante quem from vakf seal)
paper_categories: mülevven kâğıt (6+ renk: sarı/chartreuse, pembe/gül, zeytin yeşili, parlak yeşil + turuncu iki renkli sistem, mavi-gri, lacivert)
battal ebru polychrome (pp019–020 — 4+ renk: pembe, kırmızı, yeşil, mavi-gri)
lacivert + altın diagonal crosshatch aydınlatılmış bordür (p019)
bileşik cedvel (altın → kırmızı + lacivert sistemine evrilen)
key_features: SIX-COLOR MULEVVEN sequence — most extensive polychrome mülevven among examined Süleymaniye Murakka albums: yellow/chartreuse (p002), pink/rose with zerefşân (p007), olive/sage-green (p008), bright green inner + orange/terracotta outer two-color system (p012), blue-grey panels (p016), lacivert illuminated border (p019)

CRITICAL HALKAR → BATTAL EBRU RECLASSIFICATION (p020): polychrome four-color battal ebru (pink, red, green, blue-grey) on closing pages pp019–020 — triage misidentified as halkar at thumbnail scale; unmistakably confirmed as stone marbling at IIIF resolution

FIVE named calligraphers by ketebe: Derviş Ali (d. 1085/1673, teacher of Hâfız Osmân) + Osman (prob. Hâfız Osmân d. 1110/1698) + İsmâʿîl Zühdî (d. 1221/1806, brother of Mustafa Râkım) + Ayasofya Muarrifi Muhammed + İsmâʿîl b. Ali — spanning 133 years; Fethizâde Mustafa Efendi vakf AH 1202/1787–88 (shared with SM 00009)

Lacivert + gold diagonal crosshatch illuminated border (p019); gold floral vine başlık (p018); compound cedvel evolving from gold-only to red+gold+lacivert across album; YEK ID 325915; IIIF ID 0000000356075; 22 yaprak; 9 of 20 pages examined

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Nuri Arlasez Koleksiyonu

key_features: Hatip ebru cover (p001): unusual dark-ground palette (olive-green/gold-cream/blue-grey botanical motifs with orange-red dots) — 7th confirmed hatip ebru in corpus
FIRST confirmed green mülevven in Nuri Arlasez collection; sage-green dyed paper as full-page calligraphy mounting ground throughout interior (pp003–006)
Zühdü Efendi calligrapher; inside cover note 'Duble renkli kâğıt üzerine' explicitly records colored paper
YEK ID 406054; IIIF ID 0000000398367; 8 yaprak; 6 IIIF pages

entries.collection: Süleymaniye Yazma Eser Kütüphanesi — Nuri Arlasez Koleksiyonu
entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
paper_categories: taraklı ebrulu kâğıt (kapak — ONLY confirmed taraklı cover in 252-album triage)
key_features: ONLY confirmed taraklı ebru cover in entire 252-album visual triage corpus — regular evenly-spaced parallel arcs from multi-toothed comb (tarak), definitively NOT gel-git
DUAL-SUBTYPE ebru program: taraklı cover (p001) + battal margins (pp002–003) — intentional pairing of two marbling techniques for two structural zones
Polychrome taraklı palette: green, orange, cream/gold, brownish-purple/mauve, blue-grey
Mehmed Nuri calligrapher; YEK ID 406048; IIIF ID 0000000398373; 3 yaprak

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
paper_categories: zerefşân (p028 margins confirmed; cream pages muhtemel)
key_features: LARGEST murakkaʿ in 252-album triage (28 pages / 27 yk.) with 12+ decorated pages (vs 4 in triage)
7th confirmed hatip ebru: pink/salmon gül rosettes on grey-green battal grounds (pp002, 005, 008) — FIRST hatip ebru in Süleymaniye Murakka Koleksiyonu
Extraordinary p028: gold nastaliq-influenced calligraphy on LACIVERT mulevven writing surface with zerefşân margins — one of very few colored-paper writing surfaces in corpus

Five-category decoration program; candy-stripe cetvels (workshop marker paralleling hamidiye_00010 and tiem_02471); three calligraphers (Hüseyin b. Ramazan, Muhammed b. İsmail, İbrahim); YEK ID 325920; IIIF ID 0000000356070

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات
key_features: THREE DISTINCT EBRU TYPES in one album: 1 battal + 2 gel-git in different palettes
Bright green-painted pervaz border frame on all three calligraphic openings (unusual)
Calligrapher: Mehmet Şevki (prob. Mehmed Şevki Efendi, 1829–1887)
Closest parallel: na_00270 (5 battal palettes + gel-git, AH 1195)

entries.title: Muraqqaʿāt / مرقعات

Menzil taşı (milestone inscription) genre — rare epigraphic album
Başçuhadar Hüseyin Ağa attribution (court official patron, AH 1138/1725-26)
